args.query: mathlib4 continuous partial derivatives implies differentiable at point "continuousOn" "partial" has_fderiv_at_of_has_fderiv_at"

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-
Suppose f : ‚Ñù^n ‚Üí ‚Ñù is differentiable in a neighborhood of x0 and that Df is continuous at x0.
Show that f is differentiable at x0. (That is, C^1 implies differentiability.)

We state a general version in Mathlib terms: if f is differentiable on an open neighbourhood U of x0
and the map x ‚Ü¶ fderiv ‚Ñù f x is continuous at x0, then f has the derivative fderiv ‚Ñù f x0 at x0.
-/

variable {n : Nat}
variable {x0 : Fin n ‚Üí ‚Ñù}
variable {f : (Fin n ‚Üí ‚Ñù) ‚Üí ‚Ñù}

theorem C1_on_at_implies_has_fderiv_at
  (U : Set (Fin n ‚Üí ‚Ñù)) (hU : IsOpen U) (hx : x0 ‚àà U)
  (hdiff : DifferentiableOn ‚Ñù f U)
  (hcont : ContinuousAt (fun x => fderiv ‚Ñù f x) x0) :
  HasFDerivAt f (fderiv ‚Ñù f x0) x0 := by sorry
